cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then forecast to turn northwest toward the Bahamas and south Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect yet (Bahamas and Cuba under hurricane watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings in effect yet (Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas under hurricane warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially south and east coasts including Miami-Dade and Broward counties
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts possible; sustained tropical-storm to possibly major-hurricane winds depending on exact track
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge 5–10 ft above ground possible along Biscayne Bay and Atlantic barrier islands
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches possible with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents, port access channel shoaling and debris
